temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph
Interface Graph

All Superinterfaces:
GraphAttrCollection
All Known Subinterfaces:
Digraph, MutableDigraph, MutableGraph, MutableUGraph, UGraph
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdjList, BasicDigraph, BasicUGraph, DiAdjList, UAdjList
public interface Graph
extends GraphAttrCollection

Interface for any kind of graph.

Graphs may be one of directed or undirected and one of mutable or read-only.

Whether or not a graph is directed changes the semantics of some of the node and edge functions. These changes are documented with the Node, Edge, Digraph, and UGraph interfaces. Although it is possible to have a graph which contains both directed and undirected edges, this library only supplies implementations of graphs which are either fully directed or fully undirected, and hence exactly one of the Digraph and UGraph interfaces will be implemented.

Mutable graphs implement the MutableGraph interface, which extends this interface with operations for adding, removing, and "moving" nodes and edges.

Method Detail

nodeSize

int nodeSize()
Returns the number of nodes in the digraph. If the graph is not a MutableGraph, the number of nodes indicates at the same time the range of the node identifiers. If nodeSize() returns s, then
  1. There are s nodes in the graph
  2. Each node has a unique id in the range [0,s)

See Also:
Node.nodeId()

nodeAttrSize

int nodeAttrSize()
Return the size of an attribute array for the graph.

The returned size is only guaranteed to be valid for as long as the graph does not make use of the methods specific to MutableGraph.

Returns:
the minimal required size for an ad-hoc node attribute array.

edgeSize

int edgeSize()
Returns the number of edges in the digraph, indicating at the same time the range of the edge identifiers. If edgeSize() return s, then
  1. There are s edges in the graph
  2. Each edge has a unique id in the range [0,s)

See Also:
Edge.edgeId()

edgeAttrSize

int edgeAttrSize()
Return the size of an attribute array for the graph.

The returned size is only guaranteed to be valid for as long as the graph does not make use of the methods specific to MutableGraph.

Returns:
the minimal required size for an ad-hoc edge attribute array.

addFilter

void addFilter(GraphFilter f)
Add a graph filter, restricting the nodes and/or edges in the graph.

removeFilter

GraphFilter removeFilter()
Remove the last added graph filter.

Returns:
the last added graph filter, or null if no such filter exists.

clearFilters

void clearFilters()
Clear all the node filters.

getFilter

GraphFilter getFilter()
Return the currently installed graph filter for this graph, which may be a ListGraphFilter implementing all the added GraphFilters.

Returns:
an GraphFilter for this graph, or null if no such filter exists.

node

Node node(int id)
Return the node object with id id

If this graph is mutable, the ids of nodes may change as a result of removing nodes or edges. Hence, this method should be used with care to guarantee the expected Node is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if id is out of bounds.
